Class GameController

java.lang.Object
com.comp2042.controller.GameController
All Implemented Interfaces:
InputEventListener
public class GameController extends Object implements InputEventListener
Central controller responsible for handling game logic, state transitions, and communication between the model (Board) and the GUI layer (GuiController).

This controller manages:

  • Piece movement and collision handling
  • Row clearing and score updates
  • Game mode behavior (Classic and Time Attack)
  • Hold and preview piece systems
  • Game-over conditions and leaderboard updates
It receives input events via InputEventListener and updates the GUI based on the current game state.

  • Constructor Details

    • GameController

      public GameController(GuiController guiController)
      Constructs a GameController with the specified GUI controller. Initializes the game board, binds score, and sets up the initial view.
      Parameters:
      guiController - the GuiController to use for view updates

  • Method Details

    • handleGameOver

      public void handleGameOver()
      Handles the game over state. Saves the score, updates high score, and displays game over screen.

    • startClassicMode

      public void startClassicMode()
      Starts a new game in Classic mode. Disables time attack features and resets game state.

    • startTimeAttackMode

      public void startTimeAttackMode()
      Starts a new game in Time Attack mode. Enables the countdown timer and time-based gameplay.

    • getCurrentGameMode

      public HighScoreManager.GameMode getCurrentGameMode()
      Gets the current game mode.
      Returns:
      the current GameMode (CLASSIC or TIME_ATTACK)

    • getLeaderboardScores

      public List<Integer> getLeaderboardScores(HighScoreManager.GameMode mode, int count)
      Gets the top scores for a specific game mode.
      Parameters:
      mode - the GameMode to get scores for
      count - the maximum number of scores to return
      Returns:
      a list of top scores in descending order

    • onDownEvent

      public DownData onDownEvent(MoveEvent event)
      Handles the down movement event for the current piece. Moves the piece down, handles collisions, clears completed rows, and spawns new pieces.
      Specified by:
      onDownEvent in interface InputEventListener
      Parameters:
      event - the MoveEvent containing movement details
      Returns:
      DownData containing cleared row information and updated view data

    • onLeftEvent

      public ViewData onLeftEvent(MoveEvent event)
      Handles left movement event for the current piece.
      Specified by:
      onLeftEvent in interface InputEventListener
      Parameters:
      event - the MoveEvent containing movement details
      Returns:
      updated ViewData after the movement

      Returns:
      updated ViewData after the rotation

    • createNewGame

      public void createNewGame()
      Creates a new game with fresh state. Resets the board, score, held piece, and timer based on game mode.
      Specified by:
      createNewGame in interface InputEventListener

    • onGhostCheck

      public boolean onGhostCheck(ViewData brick)
      Checks if a piece position would result in a collision. Used for ghost piece calculation.
      Specified by:
      onGhostCheck in interface InputEventListener
      Parameters:
      brick - the ViewData containing piece position and shape
      Returns:
      true if the position would cause a collision, false otherwise

    • onHardDrop

      public DownData onHardDrop(ViewData brick)
      Handles hard drop event. Instantly drops the piece to its landing position and locks it.
      Specified by:
      onHardDrop in interface InputEventListener
      Parameters:
      brick - the ViewData of the piece to drop
      Returns:
      DownData containing cleared row information and updated view data

    • getCurrentBrick

      public ViewData getCurrentBrick()
      Gets the current piece view data.
      Specified by:
      getCurrentBrick in interface InputEventListener
      Returns:
      ViewData for the current piece

    • getNextPieces

      public List<int[][]> getNextPieces(int count)
      Gets the next pieces for preview display.
      Specified by:
      getNextPieces in interface InputEventListener
      Parameters:
      count - the number of upcoming pieces to retrieve
      Returns:
      list of 2D arrays representing piece shapes

    • onHoldEvent

      public boolean onHoldEvent()
      Handles the hold piece action. Swaps the current piece with the held piece, or stores it if none is held.
      Specified by:
      onHoldEvent in interface InputEventListener
      Returns:
      true if the hold was successful, false if hold is not available

    • getHoldPiece

      public int[][] getHoldPiece()
      Gets the currently held piece data.
      Specified by:
      getHoldPiece in interface InputEventListener
      Returns:
      2D array representing the held piece shape, or null if no piece is held

    • pauseGame

      public void pauseGame()
      Pauses the game. Pauses the Time Attack timer if in that mode.

    • resumeGame

      public void resumeGame()
      Resumes the game. Resumes the Time Attack timer if in that mode.
